questions.clue: This pioneering aviator became the first woman to fly solo across the Atlantic Ocean in 1932.
As the first female computer programmer, she developed an algorithm for Charles Babbage's proposed mechanical computer.
Known for her work as a World War II spy, this woman helped organize resistance efforts in France.
In the 1950s, this African American mathematician helped calculate trajectories on the first manned NASA spaceflights.
This Chinese empress, ruling during the Tang Dynasty, was known for expanding China's territory and enhancing its influence.
This force keeps your feet firmly planted on the ground.
A flashlight beam demonstrates this principle by showing light travels in straight lines.
When you rub a balloon on your hair and it sticks to a wall, it's due to this static phenomenon.
The heat transfer used by a microwave oven to warm up your leftovers occurs via this process.
A bike leaning into a turn utilizes this force to counteract gravity, allowing the rider to remain upright.

categories.name: Cuisine Cultures: More Than Just a Meal

questions.clue: With its roots in Naples, this Italian dish typically features a thin crust topped with tomato sauce and mozzarella.
This Japanese dish composed of vinegared rice, combined with ingredients like raw fish and vegetables, is known worldwide.
This Korean dish of fermented vegetables, often including cabbage and radishes, plays a key role in Korean cuisine.
Named for the clay oven it is cooked in, this Indian bread is often served with curry dishes.
Originating from the Peruvian Andes, this grain known as the 'mother of all grains' by the Incas, is high in protein.
For 200: 'Call me Ishmael.' opens this epic novel by Herman Melville.
For 400: This Jane Austen novel begins with the line, 'It is a truth universally acknowledged, that a single man in possession of a good fortune, must be in want of a wife.'
For 600: 'It was the best of times, it was the worst of times' begins which Charles Dickens novel?
questions.answer: What is A Tale of Two Cities?

questions.clue: For 800: The novel that begins with 'All happy families are alike; each unhappy family is unhappy in its own way.' was written by this Russian author.
For 1000: Identify the novel that begins, 'In my younger and more vulnerable years my father gave me some advice that I've been turning over in my mind ever since.'
For $299, this digital music player revolutionized how we listen to songs on the go in 2001.
Launched in 2010, this device brought tablet computing to the masses.
This intelligent voice assistant, first appearing on smartphones in 2011, answers questions and performs tasks.
In 2004, this social networking platform was launched from a Harvard dormitory and is now a global phenomenon.
This Elon Musk company, founded in 2002, aims to reduce space transportation costs with the ultimate goal of enabling Mars colonization.

final.clue: Published in 1865, this book by Lewis Carroll introduced readers to phrases like "mad as a hatter" and "down the rabbit hole."
